intro: Stenostomum acreanum, commonly known as the narrow-mouthed grass. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Poaceae, characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are arranged in spikelets, which are typical of the grass family. Stenostomum acreanum is noted for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils and its role in stabilizing soil in wetland ecosystems.
